subject: Investing
title: Guru Worship and Authority Bias
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Guru Worship and Authority Bias.

hook.text: A famous investor recommended a stock on TV. It surged 15% in two days. It lost it all within a month.

buildup.text: Authority bias makes us trust experts without questioningâ€”even when their track record is mixed.

discovery.text: Studies show celebrity stock picks underperform the market on average over the following 12 months.

twist.text: Gurus often talk about positions they already own. Their incentive is your buying pressure, not your gain.

climax.text: Treat expert opinions as one input, not a command. Do your own research before acting.

punchline.text: Listen to experts. Just don't follow them blindly.

quiz.question: What is authority bias in investing?
options: Blindly following experts without critical analysis
